column4: is there another distro that has PAE in a 32bit desktop kernel?
is there a reason you want to use the 32bit vs the 64?
yes\
care to share it?
flash, java

there is a beta flash package out for 64bit that works quite well (i do get errors but its only a grey flash window, all i have to do is refresh page to fix) and I believe java supports 64 bit as well
given that i work at an online video company which coincidentally has a flash video player i kinda need a stable version of flash

check this link out... might be worth trying... seems for the most part fairly stable, plus, you'll be ahead of the curve developing for 64bit flash ;) :http://labs.adobe.com/technologies/flashplayer10/
was I unclear in some way?:)
perhaps... did you mention you have tried the adobe v10 for 64bit linux already?
no, if it's beta i'm not installing it on my production machine
I'm sorry, you said you were a developer... didn't realize it was a production machine
AFAIK there's no stable 64bit java plugin
http://www.phoronix.com/scan.php?page=news_item&px=NjkyOQ
or more directly : https://jdk6.dev.java.net/6uNea.html
it's Early Access; it's not released as stable
yup... just was giving a heads up in case you didn't know... so hopefully though you'll be able to get stable versions soon
how about the windows only binary codecs? do they work on 64bit?
that I'm not sure of... this is my home cpu so I'm running the 64bit beta's... sorry
wait... was that sarcastic?
no, i'm genuinely interested; i need those to work before i can switch
